page.title: 06Ticehurst School - Present
page.content: The school was built in 1846. The outside was last painted in 1982, the inside in 1967. It has 5 classes, 2 small halls, 1 music room and a T.V. and resources room. At the front is a lovely garden with a pond, lawns, flowers and trees. Around the back of the school is a hard playground. There are 4 classroom huts but only two are joined to the main building. Most of the class would like better sport facilities with proper changing rooms. They like the computer and the new disc drive. Kathryn's mum who's chairman of the P.T.A. said that it was enjoyble and good to be involved with the school. The P.T.A. raises about Â£1,000 a year and has provided us with such things as reading labs, P.E. apparatus, record player, a video, sports equipment and musical instruments.
